# Reinvestment - Integral Seed

## Overview

*   **Website**: https://useintegral.com/
*   **Overview**: Integral is building data infrastructure for biopharma to automate compliance processes for de-identified data as a wedge to move up the data stack to power analysis, data sharing, and data purchasing.
*   **Management Team**: Shubh Sinha (CEO); John Kuhn (CTO)

## Financing

*   **Previous financing**: Virtue led the previous $2.1M SAFE, with participation from Array Ventures, Caffeinated Capital, GPV and strategic angels, at an $8M post-money cap. Virtue had invested $640K for 8% ownership
*   **Round Size**: $4.35M
*   **Valuation**: $20M
*   **Virtue Investment Amount & Ownership**: $150K for 6.7% ownership following the Seed
*   **Financing Instrument**: SAFE
*   **Syndicate**: Haystack (lead), The GP (new), Venrex (new), and Caffeinated Capital (existing)

## Seed Data Room

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1ArS4Ubut7gwfbK49NcCLe3WilsuxVvxx?usp=drive_link

## Key Updates

**Commercial**. Integral is live with 3 customers today (Purple Lab = health tech, Eli Lily = pharma, and CMI = healthcare media agency) with $15K in monthly revenue with their current usage-based revenue model for their automated expert determination product. The company has multiple large enterprise customers in the pipeline (LiveRamp, Komodo Health, Albertsons, AbbVie, Moderna) as they evolve their pricing model for SaaS pricing and additional product lines.

**Product**. Integral has already analyzed 4B+ records across a variety of data sources, such as de-identified lab, SDoH, demographic, and claims data. Integral's average processing time is < 1 day (compared to an industry average of 6-12 weeks) and their average installation time for on-prem software < 1 day. Given their current foothold with their expert determination product, they are seeing strong interest in their V1 analytics feature (e.g., Qlik/Tableau replacement) that builds on top of their compliance platform.

## Key Updates (continued)

with their current usage-based revenue model for their automated expert determination product. The company has multiple large enterprise customers in the pipeline (LiveRamp, Komodo Health, Albertsons, AbbVie, Moderna) as they evolve their pricing model for SaaS pricing and additional product lines.

**Product**. Integral has already analyzed 4B+ records across a variety of data sources, such as de-identified lab, SDoH, demographic, and claims data. Integral's average processing time is < 1 day (compared to an industry average of 6-12 weeks) and their average installation time for on-prem software < 1 day. Given their current foothold with their expert determination product, they are seeing strong interest in their V1 analytics feature (e.g., Qlik/Tableau replacement) that builds on top of their compliance platform.

With its current cash balance, Integral has the potential to scale to $3-$4m ARR with this round (14 customers across 3 verticals & 3 product lines)` |
| `Land and expand potential` |

After seeing the speed and automation, the Chief Marketing Officer at Albertsons naturally gravitated towards a number of new use cases they couldn't execute with previous processes, such as combining pharmacy, SDoH, and grocery purchase data to better understand consumer behavior.` |

## Case for 10X

With every reinvestment, we use our privileged access and position with management teams to re-underwrite our investment case to ensure 10x potential from its current valuation. Given the current $20M valuation, Integral leaves itself open to $200M - $400M exit ranges that we have historically seen in the life science analytics space (Veeva/Crossix, IQVIA/Lasso, PRA/Symphony). At the same time, Integral has positioned itself as the middleware for data compliance in the life sciences to take a larger percentage of the $40B life sciences analytics market. Integral has the potential to exhibit many of the characteristics that drive higher multiples for life science analytics companies on the public market - high margins, capital efficiency, and sticky revenue growth. These characteristics drive the strong revenue and EBITDA multiples (below) pharma tech companies see in market compared to other healthcare businesses.
